alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:25PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tuscaloosa County through 300 PM CDT... At 225 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, or near Holt, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tuscaloosa, Northport, Holt, Brookwood, Coaling, Lake Wildwood, University Mall, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, McFarland Mall, Lake Tuscaloosa, Lake Tuscaloosa Dam, Fleetwood, Cottondale, East Brookwood, Camp Horne B.S.A., Sexton Bend, Peterson, Lake Harris, Lake Nicol and Highway 69 Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
